results.title: The Clarinet. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, EFVA and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Jack Brymer of the BBC Symphony Orchestra talks about the history of the clarinet. He demonstrates all the instruments which form the clarinet family, from the high E flat to the contra bass, showing how they work and how to play them. Director Muir Mathieson was music director/composer for Sir Alexander Korda’s London films in the 1930s and 1940s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, EFVA and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: Matter of taste
results.creator_credit: David H. Gluck, James B. Maas, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David H. Gluck, James B. Maas, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society

results.title: Paul Tortelier: the cello. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Opens with a brief recapitulation of the history of the instrument. Paul Tortelier with four cellists from the National Youth Orchestra plays the opening of Rossini’s William Tell Overture. The chamber works of Schumann and Brahms are discussed and Tortelier gives insights into how he combines skill, artistry and musicianship as he plays his own Toccata.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.
results.description:

results.title: The Bassoon
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The history and technique of the bassoon are explained by Archie Camden, one of the world’s most renowned players of the bassoon. He explains the complex fingering, and demonstrates intonation, staccato playing and trills. Ends with Camden’s famous arrangement of ‘Allegro Spiritoso’ by Senaille.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The history and technique of the bassoon are explained by Archie Camden, one of the world’s most renowned players of the bassoon. He explains the complex fingering, and demonstrates intonation, staccato playing and trills. Ends with Camden’s famous arrangement of ‘Allegro Spiritoso’ by Senaille.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The history and technique of the bassoon are explained by Archie Camden, one of the world’s most renowned players of the bassoon. He explains the complex fingering, and demonstrates intonation, staccato playing and trills. Ends with Camden’s famous arrangement of ‘Allegro Spiritoso’ by Senaille.

results.title: The Icarus wish
results.brief_description: The awe of flight, the wonder of a bird, the freedom of riding a current of air. Multiple screen images condense the emotions of two boys of different cultures. A jet liner, a bird, a kite and a paper airplane are the segments of this non-verbal adventure in visual literacy.
results.description: The awe of flight, the wonder of a bird, the freedom of riding a current of air. Multiple screen images condense the emotions of two boys of different cultures. A jet liner, a bird, a kite and a paper airplane are the segments of this non-verbal adventure in visual literacy.

results.title: The Hooowling
results.brief_description: Chaos ensues when a mother leaves her baby under the supervision of its father while she goes to the doctor. Left in a high-chair to fend for himself while his father repairs the kitchen sink, the baby gradually turns the kitchen into a war zone.
results.description: Chaos ensues when a mother leaves her baby under the supervision of its father while she goes to the doctor. Left in a high-chair to fend for himself while his father repairs the kitchen sink, the baby gradually turns the kitchen into a war zone.

results.title: The Frij
results.brief_description: A dedicated restaurant owner married to his work tries to convince his fridge not to divorce him. Despite his pleading, she has packed her bags and is determined to leave.
